name: Sierra AI
title: AI Agent Company with Outcome-Based Pricing

classification.classificationRationale: Tentative Model 5a. Sierra AI is an AI-native startup building enterprise AI agents, co-founded by Bret Taylor (ex-Salesforce co-CEO, OpenAI Board Chair) and Clay Bavor (18-year Google veteran). The company is a product lab building AI agents with outcome-based pricing. Structural: distinct product development function. Low confidence because internal organizational structure is not described — only founder backgrounds and business model.

description:
Sierra AI, co-founded by Bret Taylor and Clay Bavor, builds AI agents for enterprises with an innovative outcome-based pricing model: 'We only charge our customers when their agent successfully completes the task.' Taylor's career path (Google Maps → FriendFeed → Facebook CTO → Salesforce co-CEO → OpenAI Board Chair → Sierra) and Bavor's (18 years at Google, Gmail/Drive/Docs/Labs/AR-VR → Sierra) bring deep enterprise and AI product experience.

The founders emphasize internal AI-first culture: 'can't succeed if they're not the poster child for automation.' Taylor frames AI agents as the next major organizational unit, predicting 'agent' will stick as a category term like 'app.'

Sierra represents a product-first AI company where the business model (outcome-based pricing) reflects organizational confidence in AI agent capability.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: Co-founders: Bret Taylor (ex-Salesforce co-CEO, OpenAI Board Chair), Clay Bavor (ex-Google, 18 years)

mechanisms.name: Put Executives on the Tools
mechanisms.evidence: Founders emphasize internal AI-first culture: 'can't succeed if they're not the poster child for automation.' Leadership uses AI tools internally as organizational principle.

quotes.text: We only charge our customers when their agent successfully completes the task.
quotes.speaker: Clay Bavor

layers.label: Initial Documentation

openQuestions: How is Sierra AI structured internally? Engineering vs. product vs. research?
What is the team size and composition?
How does Taylor's board role at OpenAI affect Sierra's positioning?
taxonomyFeedback: Outcome-based pricing as an organizational signal: if you only charge when the agent succeeds, the org must be structured for quality/reliability over volume. This business model shapes org design.
AI-native startups like Sierra don't fit neatly into the taxonomy which was designed for established orgs adopting AI. The whole company IS the AI product.
